did.unittitle: Fragments of the deed from Indians to Lion Gardiner
did.abstract: Lion Gardiner (1599-1663) was an English colonist who founded the first English settlement on Long Island, New York. In 1639 he purchased an island located from the Montaukett tribe on the eastern end of Long Island (today known as Gardiners Island). The collection contains fragments of what is believed to be a deed from the Indians to Lion Gardiner, circa 1639-1663. Presumably the deed is for Gardiners Island or other nearby property.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Fragments of the deed from Indians to Lion Gardiner, 2016.009, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

custodhist.head: Custodial History note
custodhist.p: Based on notation found with the fragments, the deed was acquired by the Long Island Historical Society (now Brooklyn Historical Society) sometime prior to April 1865.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Immediate source of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in January 2016.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Lion Gardiner (1599-1663) was an English colonist who founded the first English settlement on Long Island, New York. In 1639 he purchased an island located from the Montaukett tribe on the eastern end of Long Island (today known as Gardiners Island).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fragments of what is believed to be a deed from the Indians to Lion Gardiner, circa 1639-1663. Presumably the deed is for Gardiners Island or other property on the eastern end of Long Island. There are nine pieces in total. Included in the file is a Long Island Historical Society envelope which once contained the fragments.
